original: Björkman, Halvor Georg Adolf, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 30/ 5/90 i Hommelvik, Norge, av disp. Herman B. o. Agnes Hedrén. G. 1. 19-27 m. Julia Sand; 2. 27 m. Karin Sundquist-Grevillius. Barn : Gunnel f. 22, sjuksköt., Sthlm. — Mog:ex. i Örebro 08, med. kand. i Upps. 12, med. lic. i Sthlm 18. Stud :res. t. Berhn o. Frankfurt 22, Köpenhamn 24, Bordeaux o. Paris 36. Avd :läk. v. Re-servespital XV i Wien 16, und:läk. v. Seraf :las. öron-, näs- o. halspoliklin. 18-19, und :läk. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. öronavd. 19, bitr. läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. öronavd. 19-22, priv. prakt, i Gbg sed. 22, laryngoloig v. Vasa sjukh. tubiavd. 25-42, konsult, öronläk. v. Mölndals las. 27-33, e. läk. där 34-36, las :läk. v. Mölndals las. öronavd. sed. 37. Skr.: arb. av oto-rhinolaryngolog. inneh,
translated: Björkman, Halvor Georg Adolf, practicing physician in Gothenburg, born May 30th, 1890 in Hommelvik, Norway, to parents Herman B. and Agnes Hedrén. Married 1st in 1919 to Julia Sand, divorced in 1927; 2nd marriage in 1927 to Karin Sundquist-Grevillius. Children: Gunnel (born 1922), who works as a nurse in Stockholm. Björkman received his bachelor's degree from Örebro University in 1908, his medical degree from Uppsala University in 1912, and his medical license in Stockholm in 1918. He studied in Berlin and Frankfurt in 1922, Copenhagen in 1924, and Bordeaux and Paris in 1936. He was divisional doctor at Reservespital XV in Vienna in 1916, assistant physician at Seraf:las ear, nose, and throat clinic in 1918-1919, assistant physician at Sabbatsb. hospital ear department in 1919, and associate physician at Sahlgr. hospital ear department in 1919-1922. From 1922, he had a private practice in Gothenburg, and worked as a laryngologist at Vasa Hospital's ear department in 1925-1942. He was a consultant ear specialist at Mölndals Hospital from 1927-1933, a resident physician there from 1934-1936, and ear department chief physician at Mölndals Hospital from 1937 until the end of his career. He wrote an oto-rhinolaryngology text.

structured.description: Halvor Georg Adolf Björkman was a Swedish practicing physician in Gothenburg, born on May 30th, 1890 in Hommelvik, Norway, to parents Herman B. and Agnes Hedrén. He was married 1st in 1919 to Julia Sand and divorced in 1927; he then married Karin Sundquist-Grevillius in 1927. He had one daughter named Gunnel, who was born in 1922 and worked as a nurse in Stockholm. Björkman received his bachelor's degree from Örebro University in 1908, his medical degree from Uppsala University in 1912, and his medical license in Stockholm in 1918. He studied in Berlin and Frankfurt in 1922, Copenhagen in 1924, and Bordeaux and Paris in 1936. He had a private practice in Gothenburg from 1922 and was a laryngologist at Vasa Hospital's ear department from 1925-1942. He worked at various hospital ear departments, including being the ear department chief physician at Mölndals Hospital from 1937 until the end of his career. Björkman wrote an oto-rhinolaryngology text.
